titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 66) to preserve the cultural resources of the Route 66 corridor and to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to provide assistance.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-208, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 66 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Makes in order the Committee on Resources amendment in the nature of a substitute as an original bill for the purpose of amendment. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 76.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 230.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/29/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 66 (Route 66 corridor cultural resources preservation).
